title: What is front end technologies? - Quora

response.answer_text: The frontend is part of a website that visitors see and interact with. It can be considered as the synonym of the user interface. Different technologies that are used to develop user interface including the design, animation, and everything you see when you open a mobile or web app or a website. Apart from HTML and CSS, some of the other front end technologies that the app developers rely on include: Node package manager or NPMVue.jsIonic 4BootstrapAngularAngularJSJavaScriptBackbone.jsReactThese extremely promising technologies help in building a highly interactive front end that helps in attracting the targeted audience. Moreover, they also assist in delivering an unmatched experience to users. Different backend technologies help in developing various types of websites and mobile applications in less time. Among all these technologies, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the frontend technologies that are understood by almost all web browsers. A professional with expertise on these technologies used for frontend development is known as a frontend developer. You have to choose an experienced mobile app development company like Quytech to develop your website, web application, or mobile application. Quytech provides you both frontend and backend development services along with other professionals needed for the project development.

Front-end is a term that involves the building of webpages and user interfaces for web-applications. It implements the structure, design, behavior, and animation of everything you see on the screen when you open up websites, web applications, or mobile apps. The core 3 technologies that all modern front-end web developers work to master are HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript.  Some of the Front-end development technologies include: AngularReactVue.jsBackbone.jspolymeremberknockoutLet us talk about one specific front-end development technology: Angular  Angular is a client-side framework build using Typescript. It is based on MVC architecture. It simplifies web development by offering automatic view/model synchronization. Angular is lightweight, supports all major browsers. I hope this helped..!!
